item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 25, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Bitwarden SDK relicensed from proprietary to GPLv3 (369 points | 128 comments)
2. Cerebras Inference now 3x faster: Llama3.1-70B breaks 2,100 tokens/s (46 points | 22 comments)
3. Florida Eases Licensing Requirements for Foreign Trained Doctors (51 points | 36 comments)
4. Quantized Llama models with increased speed and a reduced memory footprint (343 points | 80 comments)
5. A Primer on Vintage Cassette Decks: How to Find a Good One (15 points | 5 comments)
6. OpenFeature – a vendor-agnostic, community-driven API for feature flagging (55 points | 10 comments)
7. Launch HN: Skyvern (YC S23) – open-source AI agent for browser automations (262 points | 56 comments)
8. Why Safety Profiles Failed (137 points | 82 comments)
9. Rsbuild – A Better Vite? (40 points | 28 comments)
10. Security research on Private Cloud Compute (221 points | 68 comments)
11. Never Missing the Train Again (215 points | 77 comments)
12. Vapi (YC W21) is hiring a founding infra engineer to handle scale ( | hide)
13. Show HN: Rust based AWS Lambda Logs Viewer (TUI) (26 points | 8 comments)
14. Zigler: Zig NIFs in Elixir (169 points | 54 comments)
15. Brush – A new compatible Gaussian splatting engine (113 points | 29 comments)

17. UnitedHealth says data of 100M stolen in Change Healthcare hack (32 points | 13 comments)

19. The brain's waste clearing lymphatic system shown in people for first time (34 points | 1 comment)
20. ST Book, the Notebook Atari ST (37 points | 11 comments)
21. Lingo: A Go micro language framework for building Domain Specific Languages (75 points | 21 comments)
22. TLA from First Principles (26 points | 3 comments)
23. The Script Creator (24 points | 1 comment)
24. Writer Underwriting Writer (4 points | 1 comment)
25. The Lion of St. Mark's Square in Venice Is Chinese (128 points | 39 comments)
26. The Anvil Text Editor (108 points | 73 comments)
27. Show HN: TypeSchema – A JSON specification to describe data models (78 points | 34 comments)
28. When Samsung meets MediaTek: the story of a small bug chain [pdf] (30 points | 3 comments)
29. Species in Pieces (41 points | 5 comments)
30. Data viz project that maps all earthquakes by magnitude (64 points | 11 comments)
